text: ludis Lily Africa banana silica our
banana silly wrestling was the last
thing in my mind when I used to work as
a labourer to support six siblings the
police officer spotted me and looking at
my physique suggested that I must join
the force that's how I began
bodybuilding and first saw WWF wrestling
on a TV set when I was in my early 20s
for two days I thought it to be an hour
long Hollywood movie and realized much
later that it's a sport having failed to
convince many for a u.s. sponsorship I
collected my paltry savings and went to
San Francisco to train the first few
years were tough but eventually I got a
break to fight in Japan and then in
Mexico movie offers from Hollywood
started coming after a few years and
then came the big break from WWE rewards
also became huge as I began beating
wrestling giants like the mighty
Undertaker having achieved everything I
wanted to bring the sport to India where
people are crazy about it look at the
enthusiasm and urge to excel amongst
them I'm sure we will soon have hundreds
joining us to become Restless frankly
speaking I was always jealous watching
for girls participating in wrestling and
the WWE arena so the moment I heard of
Calise Academy simply rushed here for me
it's wrestling which matters now and
that's why I don't even want to marry
this sport has named fame and money I
can travel abroad as well I'm an
accountant ha I was an accountant by
profession but people used to tease me
over my height I always thought I can do
wonders in wrestling and that's why I'm
here since three boys from this Academy
have already gone to frame at
WWE in the US I think now my future is
secure as well it took me years of hard
work to learn the art of wrestling but
now I want to pass it on to a new
generation Murat Rommel Sahana
my plans are to open several training
academies all away and also there's a
misconception in India that to succeed
in WWE you need to have a physique like
mine
and believe me physique doesn't matter
much in pro wrestling size is not a
factor it's only proper training and
your movement that matter in the ring
